de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IConfigGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IConfigGroup

  • public class IConfigGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing Reader configuration specific methods.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with configuration methods for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the ICfg member of ReaderModule.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigParaAsBoolean

        public boolean getConfigParaAsBoolean(java.lang.String paraName,
                                      boolean EEPROM)
        Method for getting a configuration parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraName - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the package interfaces ReaderConfig and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM container is addressed. Otherwise RAM Container
        Returns:
        boolean value
        Description:
        Method returns a parameter value, identified by parameter name. The parameter value must be previously read from the Reader, e.g. with readCompleteConfiguration().
        As the parameter value is of type boolean, only single bit parameters can be returned.
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • getConfigParaAsString

        public java.lang.String getConfigParaAsString(java.lang.String paraName,
                                              boolean EEPROM)
        Method for getting a configuration parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraName - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the package interfaces ReaderConfig and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM container is addressed. Otherwise RAM Container
        Returns:
        String value
        Description:
        Method returns a parameter value, identified by parameter name. The parameter value must be previously read from the Reader, e.g. with readCompleteConfiguration().
        The parameter value is a hex-coded string and can return a multi-byte parameter. Hex-coded string means, that a hex value of 0xAB39F1 will be returned as "AB39F1".
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • setConfigPara

        public int setConfigPara(java.lang.String paraName,
                         boolean value,
                         boolean EEPROM)
        Method for setting a configuration parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraName - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the package interfaces ReaderConfig and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        value - contains the value to be set in the internal configuration container
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM container is addressed. Otherwise RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)
        • < 0 error code

        Description:
        Overload method sets a configuration parameter value in the internal configuration container, identified by parameter name.
        This prepares the next Write Configuration command(s) to be executed to with applyConfiguration(boolean).
        As the parameter value is of type boolean, only single bit parameters can be set. This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • setConfigPara

        public int setConfigPara(java.lang.String paraName,
                         java.lang.String value,
                         boolean EEPROM)
        Method for setting a configuration parameter value.
        Parameters:
        paraName - A string with parameter name. The parameter name is one of the package interfaces ReaderConfig and must be applicable with the connected Reader
        value - contains the value to be set in the internal configuration container
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM container is addressed. Otherwise RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if OK and parameter is modified (new value overwrites previous value)
        • 0 if OK, but parameter is not modified (new value is equal to previous value)
        • < 0 error code

        Overload method sets a configuration parameter value in the internal configuration container, identified by parameter name.
        This prepares the next Write Configuration command(s) to be executed to with applyConfiguration(boolean).
        The parameter value is a hex-coded string and can set a multi-byte parameter. Hex-coded string means, that a hex value of 0xAB39F1 must be set as "AB39F1".
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • readCompleteConfiguration

        public int readCompleteConfiguration(boolean EEPROM)
                              throws FeException
        Reads the complete reader configuration.
        Parameters:
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM container is addressed. Otherwise RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Reads the complete reader configuration. This method invokes multiple sendProtocol(0x80) or sendProtocol(0x8A) and needs some time, dependent on the Reader type and the communication interface.
        It is recommended to use this method before any configuration value has to be modified. It is sufficient to read the complete configuration from the Reader once after the connection call and only, if configuration parameters have to be modified. Otherwise, an application needs not to read the configuration.

        If the Reader signals with one or more configuration pages a problem with a status (e.g. 0x15 for Read Protect), the function continuous the reading for all other configuration pages.
        The return value is then the first status received from the Reader.

      • writeCompleteConfiguration

        public int writeCompleteConfiguration(boolean EEPROM)
                               throws FeException
        Writes the complete reader configuration.
        Parameters:
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM and RAM container are addressed. Otherwise only RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method writes with multiple invokes of sendProtocol(0x81) or sendProtocol(0x8B) all configuration parameter values into the Reader's EEPROM or RAM and needs some time, dependent on the Reader type and the communication interface.
        It is recommended to use this method only, if all configuration blocks are prepared properly in the Reader object.
        Normally, applyConfiguration() meets the most application needs.

        If all configuration pages could be written successful, then the function returns ErrorCode.OK.
        If the Reader signals with one or more configuration pages a problem with a status (e.g. 0x16 for Write Protect), the function continuous the writing for all other configuration pages.
        The return value is then the first status received from the Reader.

        Take care with this method, as it changes all configuration parameters.

      • applyConfiguration

        public int applyConfiguration(boolean EEPROM)
                       throws FeException
        Writes modified configuration pages to reader.
        Parameters:
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM and RAM container are addressed. Otherwise only RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 1 if at least one page is successfully written
        • 0 if no page was written, because no parameter was modified
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method writes all modified configuration parameter values into the Reader's EEPROM or RAM.
        It is recommended to use this method after all configuration parameters are modified.

        If multiple configuration blocks must be written and the Reader signals with one or more, but not all configuration pages a problem with a status (e.g. 0x16 for Write Protect), the function continuous the writing for all other configuration pages.
        If at least one modified configuration page could be written successful, then the function returns 1 and not the return value with a Reader status.
        In this case, call ReaderModule.getLastStatus() to retrieve the status byte.
        If only one configuration block must be written and the Reader returns with a status, then this status value is returned.

        Example:
         
  NOTE: reader is an object of type de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderModule
 
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.*;
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderConfig.*;

  // method disables ISO 15693 tag driver and enables ISO 18000-3M3 tag driver
  void modifyConfiguration()
  {
      boolean drv = false;
 
      try
      {
          // if not previously done, read complete configuration from Reader (needs some time, dependent on the Reader type and the communication interface)
          int back = reader.ICfg.readCompleteConfiguration(true);       // read from Reader's EEPROM
          if( back > 0 )
          {
              printf("%s", reader.getStatusText(back));
              return;
          }
        
          drv = reader.ICfg.getConfigParaAsBoolean(ReaderConfig.Transponder.Driver.HF.ISO_15693, true);
          if(drv == true)
          {
              reader.ICfg.setConfigPara(ReaderConfig.Transponder.Driver.HF.ISO_15693, false, true); // disable driver for ISO 15693
          }

          drv = reader.ICfg.getConfigParaAsBoolean(ReaderConfig.Transponder.Driver.HF.ISO_18000_3M3, true);
          if(drv == false)
          {
              reader.ICfg.setConfigPara(ReaderConfig.Transponder.Driver.HF.ISO_18000_3M3, true, true); // enable driver for ISO 18000-3M3
          }

          int back = reader.ICfg.applyConfiguration(true);      // write to Reader's EEPROM
          if(back == 0)
          {
              // no parameter changed in the Reader
          }
          else if (back == 1)
          {
              // at least one page is successfully written
          }
          else
          {
              // Reader signals a status; no or not all parameters are changed in the Reader
              System.out.println(reader.getStatusText(back));
              return;
          }
      }
      catch(FeException ex)
      {
          System.out.println(ex.getMessage());
      }
  }

      • resetCompleteConfiguration

        public int resetCompleteConfiguration(boolean EEPROM)
                               throws FeException
        Resets complete reader configuration.
        Parameters:
        EEPROM - If true, EEPROM and RAM container are addressed. Otherwise only RAM Container
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method sets all configuration parameter values in the Reader's EEPROM and/or RAM to factory default.

        Take care with this method, as it changes probably all configuration parameters.

      • serialize

        public int serialize(boolean read,
                     java.lang.String fileName)
              throws FeException
        Method for serialization of the reader configuration into or from an XML file.
        Parameters:
        read - control parameter to read (true) from an XML file or (false) write into an XML file.
        fileName - complete file name with directory
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method enables to load (if read = true) a reader configuration from an XML file into the data containers EEPROM and RAM, or writes (if read = false) the content of the data containers into an XML file.
        The configuration in the reader keeps unchanged.

      • transferXmlFileToReaderCfg

        public int transferXmlFileToReaderCfg(java.lang.String fileName)
                               throws FeException
        Method to transfer configuration from XML file to reader.
        Parameters:
        fileName - complete file name with directory
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Opens an XML file, transfers the configuration data into the respective data container and writes afterwards the complete configuration into the Reader.

      • transferReaderCfgToXmlFile

        public int transferReaderCfgToXmlFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                               throws FeException
        Method to transfer configuration from reader to XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - complete file name with directory
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Reads the complete configuration from the Reader, saves it in the respective data container and writes afterwards the configuration data into an XML file.
